body:
I'm  getting tired of my HP mouse, and need suggestions... 

My price range is around 30$ but can go up if needed.
I would prefer it to be razer.

Thanks, ebirdy.

replies.body:
I'd you're going to buy a gaming mouse, you have to spend over $30 :P 
I'd say $50 no sale is when it gets into real gaming mice. 
Logitech mice, gaming or not usually are good quality and are good for cps.
I personally have the Razer Deathadder and LOVE it. Amazing cps, grip, performance and good for all grips. For jittering, only cps no aim I go for Claw, for normal Palm, for better aim less cps jitterclick Finger. It's very versatile and worth the money. I got an amazing deal on it and got it for $50 brand new WEEKS BEFORE BLACK FRIDAY. Up to 6400 DPI I'm pretty sure.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
http://www.amazon.com/Black-E-3lue-E-Blue-Optical-Gaming/dp/B007C3E5WM

I can reccommend you this mouse. For it's price, it's very good, and it lasts about two years. Honestly, if you want a high quality mouse, you should probably spend more than 30 dollars.

replies.body:
Just buy the DeathAdder 2013 or the Naga 2014 if you wanna get a lot of clicks, but if you wanna have a good aim go for a Logitech G600..
That's all I can say :)

replies.body:
I use a CM Storm Recon, it's perfectly fine for Minecraft PVP.

Good size, nice build, cool finish, lovely LEDs, on-the-fly DPI change (though most gaming mice have that) and 4 programmable side buttons (2 on each side, though for Minecraft I can't imagine you using them.)

I got it for around $32 USD, though it may have changed.
This is really the only gaming mouse I've tried so I can't really speak about any others ;3
replies.body_tagged:
